alert.note: Alert for Randolph (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 10 at 2:55PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A slow moving thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Randolph County through 330 PM EDT... At 254 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles southwest of Asheboro, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Asheboro, Martha and Ulah. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
